text: Jean-Christophe Lagarde (born 24 October 1967) is a French politician serving as president of the Union of Democrats and Independents (UDI) since 2014. He succeeded Jean-Louis Borloo after a short interim by Yves Jégo. Lagarde has been the member of the National Assembly for the fifth constituency of Seine- Saint-Denis since 2002. ==Political career== A native of Châtellerault, Vienne, Lagarde was Mayor of Drancy from 2001 to 2017 and has been the member of the National Assembly for Seine-Saint-Denis's 5th constituency since the 2002 legislative election. In the National Assembly, Lagarde was a member of the Committee on Legal Affairs from 2002 until 2012.Jean-Christophe Lagarde French National Assembly. He also served as one of the Assembly's vice- presidents, from 2006 until 2007 and again from 2010 until 2012.Jean- Christophe Lagarde French National Assembly. In the 2012 presidential election, Lagarde publicly endorsed incumbent Nicolas Sarkozy. Following the legislative elections later that year, he joined the newly established UDI led by Jean-Louis Borloo and became the spokesperson of its parliamentary group. In the Republicans’ 2016 presidential primaries, Lagarde and his UDI endorsed Alain Juppé as candidate for the office of President of France.Simon Carraud and Leigh Thomas (October 12, 2016), French centrists back presidential hopeful Juppe Reuters.Jean-Christophe Lagarde confirme son soutien à Alain Juppé Libération, November 21, 2016. When the party's majority chose François Fillon to run in the 2017 presidential election instead, Lagarde joined Fillon's campaign team. Amid the Fillon affair, he first called on the candidate to quit the election race in favour of JuppéJohn Irish (March 5, 2017), Senior French centrist urges Fillon to step down for Juppe Reuters. but eventually suspended the UDI's support for the campaign altogether.Léo Tescher (March 1, 2017), François Fillon lâché par l'UDI France Inter.Anne-Sylvaine Chassany (March 9, 2017), Fillon moves to reboot campaign team in French presidential race Financial Times. Ahead of the Republicans' 2017 leadership election, he announced that the alliance between UDI and LR would end indefinitely in the event of Laurent Wauquiez becoming the party's chairman.En cas d’élection de Wauquiez, Lagarde (UDI) ne veut « plus d’alliance » avec Les Républicains Le Monde, December 8, 2017. Since the 2017 elections, Lagarde has been serving on the Defence Committee. In addition to his committee assignments, he is a member of the French-Algerian Parliamentary Friendship Group, the French-Tunisian Parliamentary Friendship Group and the French delegation to the NATO Parliamentary Assembly.Jean-Christophe Lagarde French National Assembly. ==Political positions== In 2013, Lagarde was – alongside Yves Jégo – one of two UDI members who voted against his parliamentary group's majority and instead supported the legalization of same-sex marriage in France.Mariage homosexuel : l'Assemblée vote le projet de loi Le Monde, February 12, 2013.
